author: Slidebean
description:
How border drones are reshaping surveillance infrastructure.

According to federal filings reviewed by Wired, Customs and Border Protection is formalizing the use of small, deployable drones for continuous monitoring.
Unlike earlier systems, these tools enable real time tracking and extend surveillance well beyond physical border lines.

As low cost drones become normalized, border security shifts from static checkpoints to dynamic sensor networks.
The long-term implication isn’t just enforcement efficiency, it’s a fundamental expansion of aerial surveillance as public infrastructure.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: The border is becoming a drone network
